habitat.description: Gelatinous cubes mindlessly patrol dungeon corridors in predictable patterns, drawn to places with abundant carrion. They serve as natural cleaners, dissolving organic matter while leaving behind polished floors. Undermountain is infamous for harboring countless specimens, including giant variants thirty feet across.

traits.name: Ooze Cube
traits.description: The cube takes up its entire space. Other creatures can enter the space, but a creature that does so is subjected to the cube's Engulf and has disadvantage on the saving throw.

traits.name: Transparent
traits.description: Even when the cube is in plain sight, it takes a successful DC 15 Wisdom (Perception) check to spot a cube that has neither moved nor attacked. A creature that tries to enter the cube's space while unaware of the cube is surprised by the cube.

actions.name: Pseudopod
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 10 (3d6) acid damage.

actions.name: Engulf
actions.description: The cube moves up to its speed. While doing so, it can enter Large or smaller creatures' spaces. Whenever the cube enters a creature's space, the creature must make a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw. On a successful save, the creature can choose to be pushed 5 feet back or to the side of the cube. A creature that chooses not to be pushed suffers the consequences of a failed saving throw. On a failed save, the cube enters the creature's space, and the creature takes 10 (3d6) acid damage and is engulfed.
